intro: Hypoestes inconspicua, commonly known as the "Snowflake" or "Rainbow Plant," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble small flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or tender perennial, featuring compact, bushy foliage. Its flowers are small and tubular, often surrounded by showy, petal-like bracts in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Hypoestes inconspicua thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
